website_summaries.verdict: Very inexpensive, basic stand that gets the job done.
pros: Good for a backup or extra stand – or if you’re on a budget
cons: Doesn’t come with the added perks of more expensive models, like a clarinet peg or bag

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a Curved Soprano Sax Stand
customer_reviews.text: Just a warning for those looking for a curved soprano sax stand....THIS IS AN ALTO SAX STAND... it does not fit a soprano. The bottom rail can not be adjusted to fit, and the top "hook" is far to wide to hold the soprano. Another review here has the soprano sitting on the floor leaning against the stand, which is not how a sax stand works. As an Alto stand, its a great value, but this is NOT a stand you can use for a curved soprano.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sturgill

customer_reviews.title: Not sure the point of having this...
customer_reviews.text: I guess I don’t know the point of this stand. We’ve bought stands like it for violins and violas and guitars and they keep the instruments from being on the floor and they display the instruments nicely. This stand, however, doesn’t do any of that. The sax is still sitting on the floor and it lays back so far we might as well have let our kid keep laying the instrument on the floor when he was done. Not worth having, really. It is a nicely built stand for the money. Very cushy etc. I just wish it was upright more and kept the instrument off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Fingers crossed .. great stand for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for the cost .. easy to put together; however, there’s no instruction sheet or information contained in the box, at all .. and nothing found HERE on the purchase page. My 10 year old sat and stared at it with a puzzled look and said he hoped he had his sax sitting in it correctly and hoped he would get more comfortable with it, after using it .. a bit nerve racking at first, I guess. His sax was thousand$ while the stand was $15. Hope we made the right choice :D
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: is ok
customer_reviews.text: not really designed for a curved soprano lower rest is too far away
customer_reviews.author: Charles R.

customer_reviews.title: Holds on like a champ
customer_reviews.text: They work fine, fold up tight, wanted to buy more but they ran out.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Sonny

customer_reviews.title: I am a professional  musician.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to state that my Saxophone did not fit properly in the stand.......it would not directly seat in center of the supports. Also the Sax stand is not very stable.
customer_reviews.author: DAN GREGAS

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, for the price
customer_reviews.text: The stand leans back further than most stands I have used in the past, but it works pretty well. It is a good buy, for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Frank G. Pratt III

customer_reviews.title: Not for a soprano.
customer_reviews.text: The overall one is because it is not for a soprano sax in any way shape or form it is for an alto sax.
customer_reviews.author: ajakl

customer_reviews.title: Consider something a little niceser, even if you're going for "cheap".
customer_reviews.text: I got this simply because I needed an extra stand - nothing fancy. However, this thing is of surprisingly low quality. The threaded receiver for the tightening screw popped out of the body of the stand and was preventing the support arm from going into the base. I fiddled with it and got it to a functional point, but even still, I couldn't tighten it enough to prevent the support arm from swinging. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon R.

customer_reviews.title: This is not for a Soprano sax.
customer_reviews.text: This is a standard Alto/Tenor stand and does not fit a curved Soprano saxophone. The body brace is not adjustable so it basically is only good for an alto.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's what I was looking for fits great and it stands great
customer_reviews.author: Neri Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Alto sax
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and saw that it was really a stand for an Alto sax. I took a chance and bought one. It works great and is inexpensive. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: thomas j long

customer_reviews.title: Too large for a curved soprano saxophone.
customer_reviews.text: NOT A SOPRANO SAXOPHONE STAND. Probably an Alto or Tenor sax stand.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my 10 year old beginning sax player.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the right size
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't the right size for the soprano sax. Too large
customer_reviews.author: William T. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap sax stand
customer_reviews.text: Good cheap sax stand. My son is in eighth grade and his rental tenor sax retails for $2,700. I cringed every time I came into his room and saw the sax on the floor. This gives me some level of assurance that he wont step on or fall over the saxophone.
customer_reviews.author: William Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: It's OK for the money, but that's it.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job; but in you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Don B

customer_reviews.title: Not a soprano stand.
customer_reviews.text: This stand fits my Alto but not my Soprano which is why I ordered it. It would work if the bottom U was about 3 1/2 inches higher.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is NOT a Soprano stand
customer_reviews.text: Based on the title containing "Soprano" stand, I had purchased this hoping it would fit my Curved Soprano better than the alto stand it currently sits in. Unfortunately, it is even worse than my alto stand. I could not come up with a way to rest my soprano in this stand without putting pressure on my keys. Sturdy little thing for an alto though, just a misleading product name.
customer_reviews.author: John Kasinecz

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit curved soprano saxophone
customer_reviews.text: This item is labeled as a stand for curved soprano and that is simply incorrect. It fits an alto saxophone perfectly, but is far too large for soprano (and not adjustable). I confirmed the part number on the box (i.e. I did not receive the wrong item).
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Minnick

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son so he would stop placing his sax on the ground or having to set it up each time he wanted to play. Does the trick — great quality for what we paid!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good sax stand
customer_reviews.text: Fine basic sax stand. I like that it hold the sax at a better angle than other stands that have equal sized legs. It doesn't have a slot for adding a soprano stand, but that's usually extraneous. This is perfect for keeping my alto ready to go. Nothing fancy, just does what it needs to do.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O

product_meta.title: Flanger Soprano Saxophone Stand (FW-005)
product_meta.description: Adjustable backrest for Alto or tenor sax; foam padded arms to prevent the instrument from damage material: iron, plastic, foam Color: Black.
feature_bullets: Adjustable backrest for Alto or tenor sax
Durable metal design can hold instrument stably
Foam padded arms to prevent the instrument from damage
